definition: lit. to have a tongue like a reed (idiom)/fig. to have a glib tongue
opportunely/coincidentally/as it happens/skillful/timely
tongue
as/as if/such as
metallic reed/spring of lock

sentences.english: Well the so called MS experts are neurologists.
sentences.chinese: 神经学家是这样巧舌如簧的。

sentences.english: Blue and eloquent, want to wear bone suitable to personally take a stake in the new company.
sentences.chinese: 蓝菲儿巧舌如簧，希望戴骨顺以个人名义入股新公司。

sentences.english: I must beg forgiveness for its glib simplification in some cases.
sentences.chinese: 我必须乞求宽恕其巧舌如簧简化，在某些情况下。

definition: to have a silver tongue/to have the gift of the gab
pinyin: san1 cun4 bu4 lan4 zhi1 she2

definition: glib of tongue (idiom)/eloquent
can talk really well (idiom); the gift of the gab
to be glib in one's speech and wear an ingratiating expression (idiom)
clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
to argue skillfully or plausibly/rhetoric
specious arguments/sophistry
graceful words, flowery speech (idiom); elegant but insincere words/cheating wheedling/dishonest rhetoric
be smooth and slick (in establishing social relations)
mouth like a torrent (idiom)/eloquent/glib/voluble/have the gift of the gab
(fig.) adaptable/able to deal with various kinds of people and situations/(derog.) insincere/two-faced
pinyin: jian4 ren2 shuo1 ren2 hua4 , jian4 gui3 shuo1 gui3 hua4
related.word: 见人说人话，见鬼说鬼话

definition: eloquent and fluent speaker (idiom); grandiloquence/the gift of the gab
eloquent/good at arguing
lit. a tongue like a reed (idiom)/fig. a glib tongue
clumsy in speech/poor speaker
faulty argument and poor rhetoric (idiom); unable to put forward any convincing arguments/without a leg to stand on
